PlotÂ¶

deside.plot.plot_corr_two_columns(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, output_dir: str, col_name1: str = 'CPE', col_name2: str = 'cancer_cell', cancer_type: str = '', diagonal: bool = True, predicted_by: Optional[str] = None, font_scale: float = 1.5, scale_exp=False)Â¶

Plot the relation between two columns in DataFrame df

Parameters

  • df â a dataFrame which contains CPE (cancer purity) and cancer_fraction

  • output_dir â result folder

  • col_name1 â column name, such as CPE (cancer purity), x axis

  • col_name2 â column name, such as cancer cell fraction (predicted cancer purity), y axis

  • cancer_type â mark x axis / y axis label

  • diagonal â if plot diagonal

  • predicted_by â model name

  • font_scale â scale font size

  • scale_exp â if scale all expression values to range [0, 10] by x_i/max(x) * 10

Returns

None

deside.plot.plot_predicted_result(cell_frac_result_fp, bulk_exp_fp, cancer_type, model_name, result_dir, cancer_purity_fp, font_scale=2.0)Â¶

Plot and evaluate predicted results of DeSide or Scaden model for TCGA data

Parameters

  • cell_frac_result_fp â the file path of predicted cell fraction

  • bulk_exp_fp â the file path of bulk cell expression profile, TPM, gene by sample

  • cancer_type â only for naming or mark x / y label when plotting

  • model_name â model name, DeSide or Scaden

  • result_dir â where to save result

  • cancer_purity_fp â estimated tumor purity for TCGA, download from Aran, D. et al., Nat Commun 6, 8971 (2015), Supplementary Data 1

  • font_scale â scale font size

Returns

None
